Section5 of the principal Act is amended(a) by inserting after the definition of 'Justice of the Peace' the following definition: '''Northern Territory'" includes the Territory of Cocos (Keeling) Islands; and (b) by adding at the end thereof the following sub-section: '(6) This Act extends to the Territory of Cocos (Keeling) Islands.'. ". Part II of the Cocos (Keeling) Islands SelfDetermination (Consequential Amendments) Bi11 1984 amends the Commonwealth Electoral Act 1918 so as to extend to the Territory community full voting rights in relation to the Australian Parliament. In particular, clause 5 of the Bill inserts a new section 5A into the Commonwealth Electoral Act 1918 to extend the operations of that Act to the Territory of Cocos (Keeling) Islands. Unfortunately, no account was taken of the section proposed to be inserted in the Commonwealth Electoral Act 1918 when a provision to renumber the Act was prepared. The renumbering provision is contained in the Commonwealth Electoral Legislation Amendment Bi11 which was introduced into this Parliament on \0 May 1984. A second Bill, the Referendum (Machinery Provisions) Bi11 1984, has also been introduced containing cross-references to the Commonwealth Electoral Act 1918, as renumbered. Those cross-references are based on the renumbering without the section proposed to be inserted by the Cocos (Keeling) Islands SelfDetermination (Consequential Amendments)

This form is generally made available to the enquirer in order to make a preliminary assessment of eligibility. At present, however, there is no requirement for posts to use this form in a uniform manner. The Department is endeavouring to achieve a standard practice at all posts with regard to this procedure.
